Count beach exceedances for enterococcus

anlz_entpep.Rd

Count beach exceedances for enterococcus

anlz_entpep(entdat, thr = 104, cats = c(0, 1, 2))

Arguments

entdat

result returned from read_pepent
thr

numeric value defining threshold for beach closure
cats

vector of three numeric values defining the color scheme for the report card

Value

A data.frame with counts of beach closures per year for each beach

Details

Exceedance threshold for closure is set by default as 104 cfu/100 ml criterion. This is simply based on counts in a year when any value at any station was above the threshold.

The outcome column in the output is defined by the numeric interval in cats, closed on the left. This is used for the color scheme in show_entmatrix.

See also

Other analyze: anlz_attainpep(), anlz_medpep()

Examples

anlz_entpep(entdat)

#> # A tibble: 280 x 4
#>    Name                     yr closures outcome
#>    <chr>                 <dbl>    <int> <chr>  
#>  1 Alberts Landing Beach  2010        0 green  
#>  2 Alberts Landing Beach  2011        0 green  
#>  3 Alberts Landing Beach  2012        0 green  
#>  4 Alberts Landing Beach  2013        0 green  
#>  5 Alberts Landing Beach  2014        0 green  
#>  6 Alberts Landing Beach  2015        0 green  
#>  7 Alberts Landing Beach  2016        0 green  
#>  8 Alberts Landing Beach  2017        0 green  
#>  9 Alberts Landing Beach  2018        1 yellow 
#> 10 Alberts Landing Beach  2019        0 green  
#> # … with 270 more rows
